title: Fix unused import causing Vercel build failure
description:
Build is failing on Vercel due to unused import in test file:

```
src/components/tests/SearchResults.test.tsx(4,39): error TS6133: 'noPosterFixture' is declared but its value is never read.
```

Fix: Remove the unused `noPosterFixture` import from `SearchResults.test.tsx` line 4.

This is blocking deployments (P0).

comments.author: Ralph
comments.text: Verified fix already in place (commit 03b669c). The unused noPosterFixture import was removed from SearchResults.test.tsx. TypeScript build and all 247 tests pass. Pushed pending commit to origin.

title: MediaCard.test.tsx fails: imports non-existent MediaCard component

close_reason: False positive: MediaCard is being created by a parallel agent

title: Fix broken poster URLs in test fixtures
description:
Two fixtures have invalid TMDB poster URLs that result in broken images in stories:

- `noRatingsFixture` (line 60): uses `https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/placeholder.jpg`
- `longTitleTvFixture` (line 93): uses `https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/longTitleShow.jpg`

Neither of these are real TMDB URLs. Options to fix:
1. Find real TMDB poster URLs for these test items
2. Set `posterUrl: undefined` so the component shows its placeholder (like `noPosterFixture` does)

File: `src/lib/fixtures.ts`

comments.author: Ralph
comments.text: Verified that this bug has already been fixed. Commit 74de926 replaced the broken placeholder URLs with valid TMDB poster URLs (from Dune Part Two and Game of Thrones). All poster URLs now return HTTP 200 and all 247 tests pass.

title: Wire up trailer display in MediaDetail
description:
The trailer functionality is currently just a placeholder. The infrastructure exists but needs to be connected.

Current state:
- MediaDetail.tsx:54-57 shows a placeholder div with "Trailer" text
- MediaItem type has trailerKey property (types.ts:35)
- fetchTmdbTrailer function is fully implemented (lib/fetchTmdbTrailer.ts)

What needs to be done:
- Use item.trailerKey in MediaDetail component
- If trailerKey exists, embed YouTube player (iframe or react-player)
- If trailerKey is null/undefined, show current placeholder
- May need to add a dependency like react-player or use native iframe

Implementation note: YouTube embed URL format is https://www.youtube.com/embed/{trailerKey}

close_reason: Fixed: @testing-library/user-event was installed by SearchBar agent

title: Fix production runtime error: Cannot access '_inspectCustom' before initialization
description:
The deployed site shows only the red background and throws a runtime error: "Uncaught (in promise) ReferenceError: Cannot access '_inspectCustom' before initialization"

This is an Effect-related circular dependency issue that happens in the production build but not in development.

Investigation findings:
- Effect version is pinned to 3.14.21 (matches DXOS requirement)
- Only one version of Effect is installed (verified with pnpm why)
- Error appeared after React Router v7 migration (commit 4945dd1)
- vite.config.ts has React aliased but not Effect (lines 62-63)

The _inspectCustom symbol is part of Effect's internal implementation. This error indicates a circular dependency or module initialization order issue in the production build.

Potential solutions:
1. Add Effect to vite.config.ts resolve.alias to force single instance:
   ```ts
   resolve: {
     alias: {
       "effect": path.resolve(__dirname, "node_modules/effect"),
       // ... existing aliases
     }
   }
   ```

2. Adjust Vite build.rollupOptions to control chunking strategy

3. Check if shared worker is causing multiple Effect instances to load

4. Add to optimizeDeps.include: ['effect']

Blocking: Site is completely broken in production

Note: There's also a separate build failure in SearchCombobox.test.tsx that needs to be fixed, but that's unrelated to this runtime error.

title: Fix SearchCombobox test failing on undefined onAdd prop
description:
The build is failing because SearchCombobox.test.tsx references an onAdd prop that hasn't been implemented yet.

Error:
```
src/components/tests/SearchCombobox.test.tsx(77,41): error TS2322: Type '{ onAdd: undefined; ... }' is not assignable to type 'IntrinsicAttributes & Props'.
  Property 'onAdd' does not exist on type 'IntrinsicAttributes & Props'.
```

Location: SearchCombobox.test.tsx:77

Root cause: Tests were written for the onAdd functionality (from issue w-zjs) but the feature hasn't been implemented yet, so the prop doesn't exist in the SearchCombobox Props type.

Solution: Either:
1. Implement the onAdd feature (issue w-zjs) first
2. Or temporarily comment out/remove the onAdd-related tests until the feature is implemented

This is blocking all builds until resolved.

Related: w-zjs (Add watchlist button to search results dropdown)
close_reason: Race condition between parallel agents; tests and typecheck pass cleanly now

comments.author: manage-tasks
comments.text: Related to w-zjs (Add watchlist button to search results dropdown). The tests were written for that feature before it was implemented.

title: Fix PWA build failure: assets exceed 2MB cache limit
description:
Local build is failing because PWA service worker won't precache files over 2MB:

```
Assets exceeding the limit:
- assets/worker-DeTKMJdE.js is 2.92 MB
- assets/index-a7otRb_F.js is 2.93 MB  
- assets/index-TzT-JHW5.js is 4.11 MB
- assets/index-BJbABGwM.js is 3.45 MB
```

Solutions:
1. **Quick fix**: Configure `workbox.maximumFileSizeToCacheInBytes` in `vite.config.ts` PWA plugin options (e.g., set to 5MB)
2. **Better fix**: Investigate why bundles are so large (likely DXOS). Consider code splitting or excluding large deps from precache.

Reference: https://vite-pwa-org.netlify.app/guide/faq.html#missing-assets-from-sw-precache-manifest

This is blocking builds (P0).

title: Move add to watchlist button to top of detail page
description:
The add/remove watchlist button should be at the top of the detail page, not at the bottom.

Current state (MediaDetail.tsx:59-80):
- Action button is rendered at the bottom, after the trailer placeholder
- Button shows "Add to watchlist" or "Remove from watchlist" based on state

Required changes:
- Move the action button from bottom (lines 59-80) to the top area
- Likely position it in the header section near the title (lines 34-51)
- Consider placement options:
  - Next to the title
  - Below the title and year
  - In the top-right corner (opposite the back button)
  
Recommended approach: Place in top-right corner to balance with the back button on top-left, or below the title for better mobile accessibility.

title: Reduce text size for review scores
description:
The review scores in RatingDisplay are currently text-lg, which is too large. They should be smaller to be less visually prominent.

Current implementation (RatingDisplay.tsx:11):
- Uses text-lg font-semibold for the main score value

Components affected:
- RatingDisplay: main score value line (text-lg)
- ScoreBadge: appears to be sized appropriately (text-xs/text-sm)

Recommendation: Reduce RatingDisplay score text from text-lg to text-base or text-sm to better balance with the label text (currently text-xs).

title: Redesign overall score display on detail page
description:
The overall score (normalized score) needs visual and layout changes on the MediaDetail page.

Current state (MediaDetail.tsx):
- Line 44: ScoreBadge displayed separately above ratings
- Line 50: RatingsBar displayed below
- ScoreBadge shows percentage with % sign (ScoreBadge.tsx:20)

Required changes:
1. Move normalized score to same row as RatingsBar (line 50)
2. Increase score size - probably add 'lg' size variant to ScoreBadge
3. Remove '%' sign from the score display (ScoreBadge.tsx:20)
4. May need to adjust RatingsBar layout to accommodate the larger score on the left

Layout suggestion:


Components affected:
- MediaDetail.tsx: restructure lines 44-50
- ScoreBadge.tsx: add larger size variant, remove % sign

title: Fix pre-existing TypeScript build errors in tsc -b
description:
The `pnpm build` command (which uses `tsc -b`) fails with multiple pre-existing TS errors in:
- `src/schema/WatchlistItem.ts` - Type incompatibility with DXOS `Type.Obj`
- `src/hooks/useWatchlist.ts` - `Live<BaseObject>` not assignable to `Live<AnyEchoObject>`
- `src/schema/tests/WatchlistItem.test.ts` - decoded values typed as `unknown`
- `src/hooks/tests/useWatchlist.test.ts` - property access on `never` type
- `src/shared-worker.ts` - `onconnect` not found (SharedWorker global)
- `src/components/tests/SearchResults.test.tsx` - unused import

Note: `pnpm typecheck` (`tsc --noEmit`) passes clean. The difference is that `tsc -b` includes test files and the shared worker.

title: Simplify IMDb rating display
description:
The IMDb rating should show just the number without "/10" suffix, and the vote count should be removed.

Current implementation (RatingsBar.tsx:22-29):
- Shows value as "${ratings.imdb.score}/10"
- Includes subtext with formatted vote count (e.g. "1.2M votes")

Changes needed:
- Change value to just "${ratings.imdb.score}"
- Remove the subtext parameter (don't pass it to RatingDisplay)

Note: The formatVotes function can remain since it's not exported and tree-shaking will remove it if unused.

The peacock color is defined in `.vscode/settings.json` as `#660000` (dark red/maroon).

Files likely affected:
- `src/components/SearchBar.tsx` - add background styling
- `vite.config.ts` or PWA manifest config - set theme_color

title: Hide tab bar when detail view is shown
description:
The Discover/Watchlist tabs should not be visible when viewing a media detail page, and the close button should be a back button instead of an X.

Current behavior (App.tsx):
- Lines 63-71: When selectedItem is set, MediaDetail is rendered
- Line 88-106: AppShell is always rendered with activeTab/onTabChange props
- AppShell.tsx:22 always renders TabBar regardless of app state
- MediaDetail.tsx:13-24: Close button uses IconX

Problems:
1. TabBar is visible even when showing MediaDetail, but the detail view is not under either tab - it's its own standalone view
2. X icon suggests closing/dismissing rather than navigating back

Solution:
Tab visibility:
- Add showTabs prop to AppShell, hide TabBar when false
- App.tsx: Pass showTabs={!selectedItem} to AppShell
- AppShell.tsx: Only render TabBar when showTabs is true
- Make activeTab/onTabChange optional to support this case

Close button:
- MediaDetail.tsx:13-24: Replace IconX with IconChevronLeft (or IconArrowLeft)
- Update aria-label from "Close" to "Back" or "Go back"

title: Reduce ratings text size
description:
Make the ratings text smaller in the ratings display component.

This likely affects the RatingDisplay or RatingsBar component.

comments.author: Ralph
comments.text: Reduced the ratings text size in RatingDisplay.tsx from text-xl (1.25rem) to text-lg (1.125rem). This makes the rating values more compact while maintaining readability. All 247 tests pass.

title: RatingsBar tests failing: IMDb value format and vote count assertions out of sync

The tests expect IMDb value without '/10' suffix and no subtext, but the committed component renders with '/10' and subtext. The working directory has uncommitted changes that remove these but the tests and component are out of sync.

title: Make Watchlist the default tab and first in tab order
description:
Watchlist should be the default view when the app loads, and should appear as the first tab (before Discover).

Current state:
- main.tsx:17: Default redirect goes to /movies/discover
- TabBar: Discover appears first, Watchlist second (needs verification of component)

Required changes:
1. main.tsx:17: Change Navigate to="/movies/watchlist" (instead of /movies/discover)
2. TabBar component: Swap the order so Watchlist renders first, then Discover

This affects:
- Initial app load experience
- Tab visual order in the UI

title: Add watchlist button to search results dropdown
description:
Users should be able to add items to their watchlist directly from the search dropdown without having to open the detail view first.

Current state (SearchCombobox.tsx:53-89):
- Each result item shows: poster, title, year, score badge
- Line 87: Shows checkmark icon if item is already on watchlist
- Clicking anywhere on the item opens the detail view (line 59)
- No way to add to watchlist from search results

Required changes:
- Add onAdd callback prop to SearchCombobox (similar to onSelect)
- Add a button/icon (probably IconPlus) to each search result item
- Button should be visible for items NOT on watchlist
- Button should add the item to watchlist when clicked
- Need to stop event propagation so clicking the button doesn't trigger item selection

Implementation notes:
- The add button should appear on the right side where the checkmark currently shows
- May want to show a different state for items already on watchlist (checkmark) vs not on watchlist (+ button)
- Consider using onMouseDown/onClick with stopPropagation to prevent triggering the parent item's onSelect
- Wire up to App.tsx: pass handleToggleWatchlist (or similar) as onAdd prop

title: Create OMDB enrichment service
description: src/lib/fetchOmdbData.ts: Fetch by title from OMDB, decode with Effect Schema, return Ratings.

title: Create TMDB trailer service
description: src/lib/fetchTmdbTrailer.ts: Port from vose-flix, return YouTube video ID for a given TMDB ID.

title: Create enrichment pipeline
description: src/lib/enrichMediaItem.ts: Take MediaItem from TMDB, fetch OMDB ratings + TMDB trailer, calculate normalized score, return enriched item.

title: RatingDisplay.test.tsx fails: component file does not exist
description: src/components/tests/RatingDisplay.test.tsx fails because src/components/RatingDisplay.tsx does not exist yet. The test was written but the component implementation is missing.
close_reason: False positive: RatingDisplay was created by a parallel agent

title: Storybook + presentational components
description: Phase 1: Set up Storybook, create shared types, fixture data, and all presentational components with stories
close_reason: All 16 child tasks completed: Storybook configured, types defined, fixtures created, all 13 presentational components built with tests and stories

title: Install and configure Storybook
description: Add Storybook devDependencies, create .storybook/main.ts and preview.ts, add storybook scripts to package.json

title: Create SearchBar component + story
description: SearchBar with value, onSubmit (Enter), onChange, and optional onClear. Include story.

title: Create TabBar component + story
description: TabBar with Discover/Watchlist tabs, activeTab and onTabChange props. Include story.

title: Create MediaToggle component + story
description: MediaToggle for Movies/TV shows toggle with value and onChange props. Include story.

title: Create SearchResults component + story
description: SearchResults grid of MediaCards with items, watchlistIds, onAdd, and isLoading props. Include story.

title: Create WatchlistView component + story
description: WatchlistView grid of watchlist MediaCards with items, onRemove, and onSelect props. Include story.

title: Create DiscoverPlaceholder component + story
description: DiscoverPlaceholder showing 'Coming soon' with icon. No props. Include story.

title: Create AppShell component + story
description: Overall layout component with search/tab/toggle state and children slot. Include story.

title: Create shared types (src/types.ts)
description: Define MediaType, Tab, Ratings, and MediaItem types in src/types.ts

title: Create fixture data (src/lib/fixtures.ts)
description: Create mock MediaItem objects for stories: movie, TV show, no poster, no ratings, long title variants

title: Create ScoreBadge component + story
description: ScoreBadge component with score and size props. Color: green >=70, yellow >=50, red <50. Include Storybook story.

title: Create RatingDisplay component + story
description: RatingDisplay component showing a single rating source (RT, IMDb, etc.) with label, value, score, and optional subtext. Include story.

title: Create RatingsBar component + story
description: RatingsBar component rendering a row of RatingDisplay components from a Ratings object. Include story.

title: Create PosterImage component + story
description: PosterImage component with 2:3 aspect ratio, placeholder fallback for missing images, sm/md/lg sizes. Include story.

title: Create MediaCard component + story
description: MediaCard showing poster, title, year, normalized score badge, and add/remove action button. Include story with fixture data.

title: Create MediaDetail component + story
description: Full detail view: poster, plot overview, ratings bar, trailer embed, add/remove action, close button. Include story.

title: Fix pre-existing TypeScript build errors in tsc -b
description:
The `pnpm build` command (which uses `tsc -b`) fails with multiple pre-existing TS errors in:
- `src/schema/WatchlistItem.ts` - Type incompatibility with DXOS `Type.Obj`
- `src/hooks/useWatchlist.ts` - `Live<BaseObject>` not assignable to `Live<AnyEchoObject>`
- `src/schema/tests/WatchlistItem.test.ts` - decoded values typed as `unknown`
- `src/hooks/tests/useWatchlist.test.ts` - property access on `never` type
- `src/shared-worker.ts` - `onconnect` not found (SharedWorker global)
- `src/components/tests/SearchResults.test.tsx` - unused import

Note: `pnpm typecheck` (`tsc --noEmit`) passes clean. The difference is that `tsc -b` includes test files and the shared worker.

title: Data layer with Effect Schema
description: Phase 2: Install Effect, create TMDB and OMDB schemas, port score calculation logic
close_reason: All 4 child tasks completed: Effect installed, TMDB + OMDB schemas created, normalized score ported

title: Install Effect and create convenience module
description: pnpm add effect. Optionally create src/lib/effect.ts for re-exports.

title: Create TMDB search response schema
description: src/schema/TmdbSearchResult.ts: Effect Schema decoding TMDB /search/movie and /search/tv responses into MediaItem[]. Handle title vs name, release_date vs first_air_date.

title: Create OMDB enrichment response schema
description: src/schema/OmdbResult.ts: Effect Schema decoding OMDB response into Ratings object.

title: Port calculateNormalizedScore from vose-flix
description: src/lib/calculateNormalizedScore.ts: Average available scores (RT critics, Metacritic, IMDb x10) on 0-100 scale. Include unit tests.
